content:
Yes, I can explain how the BBC2's budget is allocated across its various programming genres. According to the BBC's Annual Report and Accounts 2019-2020, BBC2's spending was allocated as follows:

1. Factual & Entertainment: 47.3% of the budget was allocated to factual programming, including documentaries, current affairs, and news programs. The remaining part of this category was allocated to entertainment programs like quiz shows, panel shows, and factual entertainment.

2. Drama & Comedy: 22.6% of the budget was allocated to drama and comedy programming. This includes a range of programming, from comedy dramas to historical dramas and everything in between.

3. Arts: 7.8% of the budget was allocated to arts programming, including music, dance, and arts-related documentaries.

4. Sport: 3.2% of the budget was allocated to sports programming, including coverage of major sporting events such as the Olympics and the FIFA World Cup.

5. Children’s Programming: 2.5% of the budget was allocated to children's programming, including animation, children’s dramas and children’s comedy programs.

The rest of the budget was allocated to other categories such as Music & Events, Religion, and other programming such as Science and Technology.

The figures above indicate that factual programming receives the largest share of the BBC2's budget, followed by drama and comedy.
